text: The Severe Drought
\add That\add* which came \add as\add* the word of Yahweh to Jeremiah concerning the matter\f + \fr 14:1 \ft Hebrew “matters” \f* of the severe drought.
“Judah mourns, and her gates languish,
they are in mourning on the ground,
and the cry of lament of Jerusalem goes up.
And their nobles send their servants for water.
They come to \add the\add* pits, they find no water.
They return \add with\add* their vessels ⸤empty⸥.\f + \fr 14:3 \ft Literally “without success” \f*
They are ashamed, and they are confounded,
and they cover their heads.\f + \fr 14:3 \ft Hebrew “head” \f*
Because of the ground, \add which\add* is cracked
because there was no rain on the ground.
\add The\add* farmers are ashamed,
they cover their heads.\f + \fr 14:4 \ft Hebrew “head” \f*
For even \add the\add* doe in the field gives birth and forsakes \add her young\add*,\f + \fr 14:5 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f*
because there is no green growth.
And wild asses stand on \add the\add* barren heights,
they gasp \add for\add* breath like the jackals.
Their eyes fail
because there is no vegetation.”
Although our iniquities testify against us, \add O\add* Yahweh,
act for the sake of your name.
Yes, our apostasies are many;
we have sinned against you.
\add You are\add* the hope of Israel,
its savior in time of distress.
Why should you be like an alien in the land,
or like a traveler who spreads out \add his tent\add* \f + \fr 14:8 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f* to spend the night?
Why should you be like a confused man,
like a warrior \add who\add* is not able to help?
Yet you \add are\add* in our midst, \add O\add* Yahweh,
and your name is called upon us.
You must not leave us!
Thus says Yahweh concerning this people:
“They have loved so much to wander,
they have not spared their feet.
Therefore Yahweh is not favorable to them,
now he will remember their iniquity and punish their sins.”
Lying Prophets
So Yahweh said to me, “You must not pray for this people, for \add their\add* happiness.\f + \fr 14:11 \ft Or “good” \f*

Although they fast, I \add am\add* not listening to their cry of entreaty. And although they present burnt offering and grain offering, I \add am\add* not favorable to them. But by the sword, and by the famine, and by the plague, I \add am\add* about to destroy them.”

Then I said, “Ah, Lord Yahweh, look, the prophets \add are\add* saying to them, ‘You will not see \add the\add* sword, and famine will not be yours, but reliable peace I will give to you in this place.’ ”

And Yahweh said to me, “The prophets \add are\add* prophesying lies\f + \fr 14:14 \ft Hebrew “lie” \f* in my name. I have not sent them, and I have not commanded them, and I have not spoken to them. They are prophesying to you a lying vision, and a divination, worthless, and the deceitfulness of their ⸤minds⸥.”\f + \fr 14:14 \ft Literally “heart” \f*

⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 14:15 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* thus says Yahweh concerning the prophets who prophecy in my name though I have not sent them, yet they \add are\add* saying, “Sword and famine will not be in this land.” “By the sword and by the famine those prophets will perish.

And the people \add to\add* whom they \add are\add* prophesying will be cast out into the streets of Jerusalem ⸤because of⸥\f + \fr 14:16 \ft Literally “from the face of” \f* the famine and the sword. And there will be no \add one who\add* buries them, their wives, or their sons, or their daughters. And I will pour out on them their wickedness.
The Nation Hopes in Yahweh
“And you shall say to them this word,
‘Let my eyes melt \add with\add* tears night and day,
and let them not cease,
for \add with\add* a great wound the virgin daughter of my people is broken,
\add with\add* a very incurable wound.
If I go out \add into\add* the field,
then look, those slain by \add the\add* sword.
And if I enter the city,
then look, the sickness of \add the\add* famine.
For both prophet and priest wander around through the land,
⸤they do not know what is going on⸥.’ ”\f + \fr 14:18 \ft Literally “and not they know” \f*
Have you completely rejected Judah?
Or has your soul\f + \fr 14:19 \ft Or “inner self” \f* loathed Zion?
Why have you struck us
so that there is no healing for us?
We hope for peace, but there is no good,
and for a time of healing, but look, there is terror.
We know, \add O\add* Yahweh, our wickedness,
the iniquity of our ancestors,\f + \fr 14:20 \ft Or “fathers” \f*
for we have sinned against you.
You must not spurn \add us\add*\f + \fr 14:21 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f* for the sake of your name,
you must not dishonor ⸤your glorious throne⸥.\f + \fr 14:21 \ft Literally “the throne of your glory” \f*
Remember \add us\add*!\f + \fr 14:21 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f*
You must not break your covenant with us.
Are there \add any\add* among the idols of the nation \add who\add* cause rain to pour?
Or can the heavens give showers?
\add Is\add* it not you, \add O\add* Yahweh our God?
Therefore, we hope in you, for you do all these \add things\add*.
